titles.title: Homestead National Monument of America Additions Act
Homestead National Monument of America Additions Act
Homestead National Monument of America Additions Act
Homestead National Monument of America Additions Act
To provide for additional lands to be included within the boundaries of the Homestead National Monument of America in the State of Nebraska, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Recreation and Public Lands.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 107-325.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 196.

action.text: Mr. McInnis moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 38.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on National Parks. Hearings held.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Bingaman without amendment. With written report No. 107-260.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 577.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Recreation, and Public Lands
committee.name: House Resources

bill.summary: 12/11/2001--Passed House amended. Homestead National Monument of America Additions Act - Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to acquire, from willing sellers or by donation, certain parcels of property for inclusion in the Homestead National Monument of America, Gage County, Nebraska. Requires acquisition within five years after enactment of this Act. Authorizes appropriations.Authorizes the Secretary to enter into cooperative agreements with the State of Nebraska, Gage County, local governmental units, private groups, and individuals for operation, maintenance, interpretation, recreation, and other purposes related to the proposed Homestead Heritage Highway to be located in the vicinity of the Monument.
